smell_analysis.justification: Page 13 'Autode register (Töötaja)' contains an empty diagram. The diagram shows only the frame 'class Autode register (Töötaja)' with ZERO elements inside. Threshold is 0 elements. 0 = 0, therefore smell IS present.

On page 2 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)', the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' (Identify user) appears as an oval inside the system boundary without any visible association lines to actors. The five actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur) are shown connected to the 'Vaata' use cases, but 'Tuvasta kasutaja' has ZERO actor associations. This use case has 0 actor associations, threshold requires at least 1, therefore smell IS present.

No duplicate use case names were found that describe the same activity AND are associated with the same actor. Use cases across diagrams have unique names: 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet', 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mittaktiivseks', 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid', 'Unusta auto'. All names are distinct.

No duplicate element names were found within the same package. Each register package (Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, Klientide register) contains elements with unique names within their respective packages.

No redundant data columns storing the same data without FK relationships were found. Common column names like 'nimetus' (name) and 'on_aktiivne' (is_active) appear in multiple tables but represent different contextual data for each entity type (e.g., nimetus in Riik is country name, nimetus in Auto_mark is car brand name). These are not redundant copies of the same data value.

All use cases follow a consistent verb-first naming pattern in Estonian: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End), 'Muuda' (Modify), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget). No noun-first patterns were found.

On page 9 'Auto seisundidiagramm', all states are reachable: Algus (initial) → Ootel; Ootel → Aktiivne or Unustatud; Aktiivne → Mitteaktiivne or Lõpetatud; Mitteaktiivne → Aktiivne or Lõpetatud. All 6 states (Algus, Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud) have incoming transitions from at least one other state.

On page 4 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm', all actions are reachable from the start node 'Algus': 'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada' → 'Otsi autot' (conditional) → 'Vali auto' → 'Lõpeta valitud auto' → 'Lõpp'. Every action has an incoming flow from the start node via the defined paths.

All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '0..1', '0..*', '1'; Page 6 shows '1', '0..1', '0..*'; Page 15-20 database diagrams show multiplicities like '1', '0..1', '0..*' on all FK relationships. No relationship was found missing multiplicity on either end.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 6 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 6 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 14: 3 classes; Page 15: 4 tables; Page 16: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Auto_kytuse_liik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark); Page 17: 3 tables; Page 18: 6 tables; Page 19: 2 tables; Page 20: 5 tables. Maximum is 9. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on each diagram: Page 6 - Isik has 5 connections (Kasutajakonto, Töötaja, Klient, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Riik); Page 12 - Auto has 4 connections; Page 18 - Auto has 5 connections (Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, and FK to Töötaja not shown on this page); Page 20 - Tootaja has 4 connections. Maximum is 5. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of diagram layouts shows elements are positioned with relatively uniform distances. No relationship between two elements appears to span more than twice the average element distance on any diagram. All related elements are positioned in proximity to each other.

All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs in Estonian: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End/Terminate), 'Muuda' (Modify), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget), 'Otsi' (Search), 'Vali' (Select). No use case or action starts with a noun or passive form.

All class names, table names, attribute names, and use case names have 4 or more characters. Shortest names found: 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since minimum is 4 > 3, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase letters and are singular: Isik, Töötaja, Auto, Kasutajakonto, Klassifikaator, Klient, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Riik, etc. No lowercase-starting or plural class names were found.

All attribute and column names start with lowercase letters: e_meil, eesnimi, elukoht, isikukood, perenimi, reg_aeg, sünni_kp, viimase_muutm_aeg, auto_kood, nimetus, mudel, on_aktiivne, etc. No uppercase-starting attribute/column names were found.

All database table names are singular: Isik (not Isikud), Auto (not Autod), Tootaja (not Tootajad), Klient (not Kliendid), Kasutajakonto, Riik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Tootaja_roll, etc. No plural table names were found.

No type prefixes like 'tbl_', 'uc_', 'str', 'int' were found in class, table, or attribute names. The prefixes 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK', and 'IXFK_' found in database diagrams are explicitly allowed per the rule definition and are correctly ignored.
